Images¶

mira provides a package-specific Image class that provides some simple convenience functions for handling images.

class mira.core.Image(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Provides convenience functions on top of np.ndarray for image handling.

buffer(extension='.jpg')[source]¶

Convert the image to a BytesIO object with encoding for the given extension.

Parameters

extension – The extension of the target file format, such as ‘.jpg’

Returns

The encoded file

Return type

BytesIO

property channels¶

The number of channels in the image

color(channels=3)[source]¶

Convert to color image if it is not already.

fit(width=None, height=None, cval=255)[source]¶

Obtain a new image, fit to the specified size.

Parameters

  • width – The new width

  • height – The new height

  • cval – The constant value to use to fill the remaining areas of the image

Returns

The new image and the scaling that was applied.

Return type

Tuple[Image, float]

property height¶

The height of the image

static new(width, height, channels, cval=255)[source]¶

Obtain a new blank image with given dimensions.

Parameters

  • width – The width of the blank image

  • height – The height of the blank image

  • channels – The number of channels. If 0, the image will only have two dimensions (y and x).

  • cval – The value to set all pixels to (does not apply to the alpha channel)

Returns

The blank image

Return type

Image

rbswap()[source]¶

Swap the red and blue channels for reading and writing images.

static read(filepath_or_buffer)[source]¶

Read a file into an image object

Parameters

filepath_or_buffer – The path to the file or any object with a read method (such as io.BytesIO)

resize(scale, interpolation=0)[source]¶

Obtain resized version of image with a given scale

Parameters

  • scale – The scale by which to resize the image

  • interpolation – The interpolation method to use

Returns

The scaled image

save(filepath_or_buffer, extension='.jpg')[source]¶

Save the image

Parameters

  • filepath_or_buffer – The file or buffer to which to save the image. If buffer, format must be provided

  • esxtension – The extension for the format to use if writing to buffer

scaled(minimum=-1, maximum=1)[source]¶

Obtain a scaled version of the image with values between minimum and maximum.

Parameters

  • minimum – The minimum value

  • maximum – The maximum value

Returns

An array of same shape as image but of dtype np.float32 with values scaled appropriately.

show(ax=None)[source]¶

Show an image

Parameters

ax – Axis on which to show the image

Returns

An axes object

Return type

Axes

property width¶

The width of the image
